I installed this, because I am a huge TF2 fan, and it was definitely worth it.

TF Classic has a huge variety of weapons and some features I actually miss in the sequel, such as  poisoning enemies with medkits for example, or throwing grenades and mines (with ANY class). In addition, the game has an active and welcoming community 'till this day, something I sadly can't say about today's TF2 community.

I can recommend this game to everyone who enjoyed TF2 and doesn't mind older graphics.

The first Team Fortress, LOVE IT!

If you want to play a competitive shooter, play Team Fortress 2, Overwatch, or Rainbow Six Siege. If you want to play a game to mess around with your friends, play Garry's Mod. Team Fortress Classic really has no place in 2017. If you're thinking about buying this game, please realize that the community is very toxic, and that the games I previously mentioned have a much better community and have better gameplay. There are a few servers in Team Fortress Classic that run minigame servers, and while this sounds good on paper, games like Garry's Mod or even Minecraft, have way more stable, fun, and less toxic servers. Another problem this game faces is its age. Because this game came out in 1999, there aren't many people still playing the game. Because of this, you may have a high ping connecting to most servers, as they are most likely in a different region than your own. If you do not already have Garry's Mod, please buy it instead of this game. Garry's Mod has a much larger and friendly community, and it runs on Source engine which recieves updates frequently.

Старый добрый олдскул, что тут ещё напишешь.
Team Fortress Classic – командный многопользовательский шутер от первого лица с девятью различными классами, каждый из которых со своими уникальными способностями и оружием. Большинство матчей состоит из режимов «Захват флага», «Сопровождение», «Захват контрольных пунктов», и других.
Каждый игрок вооружен оружием ближнего боя, двумя видами огнестрельного оружия и одним или двумя типами гранат. Выбор оружия зависит от класса. Выбранный класс также влияет на скорость передвижения, максимальное количество брони и здоровья, и на некоторые специальные умения.
В игре присутствуют 2 команды — Синие и Красные (англ. Blue & Red). Причины битв между этими командами неизвестны, как и те кто принимают в них участие. В каждой команде 9 классов. В игре есть несколько игровых режимов, которые зависят от карты.
В игре присутствуют 10 классов, 9 из которых доступны в большинстве режимов игры. Игра за каждый класс существенно различается, для успешной игры нужно знать тактику и стратегию игры за каждый класс. Разные классы должны уметь взаимодействовать между собой.

Earlier on I wrote a review for Counter Strike claiming it was one of the greatest mods for Half Life ever made. Well, this one, Team Fortress Classic, is other of those. This isn't actually the first Team Fortress game, as the original was released for Quake. The original idea was to turn Quake into a team-based game giving different characters a class with different guns and characteristics, allowing fora team-based play. Half Life, being hardly based on Quake's engine, obviously received great versions of classic quake mods, and TFC is one of them. At first, if you have played HL Deathmatch, this game will somewhat feel like Half Life with classes, and it kinda is, but, it adds something totally new to the HL experience, which is team roles. If you are playing a scout, a pyro, or a demoman, you are an agile attacker, and your work is to run and gun (or grenade, or flame). If you are playing as a Medic, while you do have some damage-dealing weapons (such as the awesome nailgun) your main role is that of a, well, medic. You distribute medkits to your allies so that they can recover health (no, you don't have a healing gun like in TF2). Even as a medic, you can still be an effective assassin type character. But the real assassin character is the Spy. He can disguise as an enemy unit and use a knife or gun to bamboozle them. Another type of support/assassin character is the engineer, who can build turrets who annoy and kill your enemies. And then, there are the more specialized damage dealers. The soldier is your standard Quake-style character: he has a rocket launcher, he expldoes people with rockets, and he can rocket jump for extra mobility. The  Sniper is, well, a sniper. In maps such as 2-fort (probably the most popular map), there are very good camping spots for a sniper to deliver precise killing blows. And, obviously, there is my favorite, the Heavy Weapons Guy, or HWGUY as he is called ingame (in TF2 he's called the "Heavy"). He has a minigun and a lot of HP, and his job is to act both as sort of a tanker, and as a big damage dealer: if you get in the range of his gun, you're probablly dead. 

So many different classes with their distinct gameplay is what made TFC a classic between classics. Not even Team Fortress 2 manages to be quite as statisfyingly fun as this game for me, for a very simple reason: it feels like Quake in the parts where it needs to feel like quake, such as in the very high skill ceiling, focus on mobility and fast reflexes, yet it also feels very different from quake where it needs to be different: teamwork and different roles to play. Many games such as, obvioulsy, TF2 and Blizzard's new hit, Overwatch, have learned a lot from Team Fortress Classic who will truly always be, the daddy of this whole genre (with QWTF being the grandpa).

Talk about a throw-back.  While not quite the Grand-Dadddy of team based shooters, it is a recreation of the Grand-Daddy of team based shooters.  To think that this reincarnation of the game is almost two decades old is amazing.

This game comes from an age of abstract level design, lag, and ridiculously fast paced action.  With different maps being designed for different team based games.  But, possibly the most popular of all time was Team Capture The Flag, and most likely on the map 2Fort (or if you were a Quake gamer, 2Fort5).

Younger gamers may have a little trouble adapting to the old-school style of online battle...Strafe Shooting and Rocket Jumping, all while piles of Gibs expload all around you. But the fact that almost 20 years later this game is still actively played online gives testament to the amount of fun to be had while playing.  If you want to know what the average gamer spent his entire summer, and every night, playing back in 1999...until he passed out from exhaustion, this is it (or possibly the original Team Fortress).

For the Older Gamers who wonder whether this is still worth downloading.  As of 25 June, 2017, there were about 6 dozen servers available, with about a dozen of them heavily populated.  I played nonstop in a packed server for 4 hours in one sitting before my old age got the best of me.  If you are looking to play a game you grew up with and loved, this is still a valid option.

As a TF2 player I saw that this was $.99 and had to buy it. I tried to like it but the classes are not as well defined as they are in TF2 and half the time I don't know who I am shooting at or even if I am damaging them. Pouring half my ammo into someone and not getting any indication that they are being hurt by it is unacceptable. Everyone just uses grenades just like Half-Life deathmatch and Half-Life 2 deathmatch. Twice I was killed through a wall by grenades and when I tried to go in for a melee kill once, someone blew up their grenade in my face and didn't seem to be hurt by it while I was totally gibbed.

This should be a free mod still.

Team fortress 2 is soooo much better than this in every way.
So some precious people don't like my review, so I'll explain it in detail.
This isn't free, TF2 is.
Class designs are ugly and difficult to tell apart, TF2's are obvious and great.
Level design is ugly and uninspired, TF2 has colourful and well designed levels.
It's hard to tell if you hit an enemy, TF2 has obvious audio, voice and blood effects.
Overall graphics and design are confusing, TF2 is clear.
No customization, TF2 has a large swath of weapon options and aesthetic changes.
TF2 just has deeper mechanical depth. Seriously, why would you want this game? And this has nothing to do with TFC being older. Diablo 2 is better than Diablo 3. Total Annihilation is better than Planetary Annihilation. SimCity 4 is better than SimCity 5. Halo 3 is better than Halo 4. Red Alert 2 is better than Red Alert 3. The Star Wars prequels sucked.
TF2 is just a much better designed game, they made better choices and have more and better features.
It's a good game, I'm constantly reminded how valve became popular with this Half-Life mod (or Quake mod.) I greatly recommend this game to anybody who plays TF2, or the original Half-Life.

Team Fortress Classic Review – Raymond KT

Summary: One of the most popular online action games of all time, Team Fortress Classic features over nine character classes -- from Medic to Spy to Demolition Man -- enlisted in a unique style of online team warfare. Each character class possesses unique weapons, items, and abilities, as teams compete online in a variety of game play modes

To me, Team Fortress Classic was unfairly dumped in a bin called “a team-based multiplayer shooter like Counter-Strike only messy and guff.” As I say, I know that’s an unfair comparison, but I stand by thinking the game messy. I never ever joined a Team Fortress Classic server and had a pleasant experience. It was always chaotic; it was always full of conc-jumping wunderkids; I always seemed to pick a class that felt useless; its maps always seemed to result in stalemates around single, narrow chokepoints. I never had fun. Or, well, that’s not true. There was one thing I liked about the game: feign death. The ability to at any point press a button and pretend to be a corpse. Most players would be wise to the trick and would shoot you as you lay prone on the ground, but occasionally you’d experience the wonderful thrill of watching a player walk by you unknowingly. I think I only managed to use that scenario to my advantage a few times, but it was worth it each time. A preview of what the Spy brought as a matter of course to Team Fortress 2. Before you take to the comments to lambast me: I can appreciate that Team Fortress Classic had a lot going for it. I think maybe if I’d been in a clan then I’d have liked it. Sing its praises in the comments if you feel like it. Team Fortress Classic is awesome. There are many different game types you can play on it. You can play a game with two teams where you have to capture the flag. You can play a game where you have to hunt a important person, or you can be one of the people protecting him. There are also games where both teams consist of only snipers. You do need to have the Internet to play the game, but if you are reading this review, then you already have the Internet. This game is worth playing because once you start playing, you can pick it up really easy. If you like team-play and shooting games this is for you. For being an older game TFC (Team Fortress Classic) has very nice graphics. The levels look really good and have been put together very nicely. The teams are easily distinguishable due to their obvious red and blue colors. The guns all look god and most are based of real weaponry, they are tru to form. TFC has everything Counter-Strike(CS) has but even more. The mission of the game is to attack or defend a fort (depending on which team you are). If you are on the attack team you must do your best to invade the fort with your flag. This is no easy task though as the defending team gets high powered weaponry to defend their fort with. Using your skill you need to infiltrate the base through secret passageways or just blasting in the front door guns blazing. The movement is extremely fast, but not out of control, which make the game much more fun and easier t move around without getting blown to pieces. This is purely a multiplayer game so there is a ton of replay value. Just keep playing rounds to improve your skill or play on the different team for some variety, or even try a different type of soldier to be! There is plenty of possibilities.

TFC to kiedyś była świetna gra z realistyczną grafiką, fajnymi futyrystycznymi mapami/broniami, bardzo dobrym dźwiękiem (nawet jak na dzisiejsze standardy) i świetną rozgrywką. Dziś... ah... dziś jest to tylko "ciekawostka" jak kiedyś wyglądał TF zanim powstała dwójka (niektórzy nadal myślą że TF2 to pierwsza część :/). Jeśli chcesz w ną pograć to tylko w gronie znajomych bo servwery świecą pustkami. Myślę że z małym boostem graficznym mogła by być to bardzo fajna gra w którą nawet dziś grały by tysiące użytkowników. Zapewne nowych graczy odstrasza fakt iż ta gra jest starsza i płatna w przeciwieństwie do swojej młodszej odsłony. Lecz jeśli ktoś ma dużo znajomych z TFC to bardzo polecam bo mimo swoich lat gra ma ogromny potencjał i jest strasznie grywalna.
